intro: Microstylis madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar microstylis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of white or pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
